In the fragment lifecycle, when is the best time to `ButterKnife.bind()` and `binder.unbind()`?  I’m currently using `onCreateView` and `onDestroyView`, respectively
It is Ok to bind in `onCreateView` or `onViewCreated` and unbind in `onDestroyView`.
word
Is Google still against binding?
i dont think so they have their own binding as well

they made a databinding lib but our experience with it is that it makes using recyclerview really awkward and it kept messing with dagger APT error messages so we couldn’t see what the real problem was

It’s already daunting to find some bugs in Vanilla… using external binding libs makes things more difficult.
If I wanted to internationalize a list of names, like `something(new String[]{”bob”, “jane”, “sue”, “larry"}) - > “bob, jane, sue, and larry”`, is there an android string resource mechanism for this?
you can use arrays
and it’ll comma-separate + “and” for me?

```
getResources().getStringArray(R.array.peoples_names)
```
I’m pretty sure the comma may be limited to latin character-based langs though, and my arrays of strings are not fixed (they come from the server)
so it’s not the names themselves that need to be internationalized
you want plurals then
<https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/string-resource.html#Plurals>

attachments.title: String Resources | Android Developers
attachments.text: Explains how to use string resources in your UI.

text: it’s the separation
well plurals probably doesn’t help you there specifically so writing the concatenation yourself is still the best option.
bummer
something like that probably
yeah, that’s fine for latin/english locales
i’ll give you a nutella for effort though
<@U055GGAHS> :nutella:
Sure I have no idea how formatting should appear for other languages
luckily we don’t actually support more than english yet, but it’d be nice to be prepared when the time comes
<@U055GGAHS> you might want to check out `TextUtils.join` too
<@U1JKXJJ11> that doesn’t help in his situation as he wants ‘and’ on the last
You may define strings like `%1$s, %2$s` and `%1$s and %$2s`
<@U2MG9FV3Q|iqandjoke> has joined the channel

This is more of an RxJava question, but still maybe someone knows - I have a PublishSubject that broadcasts certain state updates and I want to send the "current state" to any new observer upon subscription, is that possible in a more or less clean way?
doOnSubscribe() doesn't work for that since when it's invoked the new observer is not yet in the subject's observer list and Subject.onNext doesn't reach it
<@U055GGAHS> you're right, it's not sufficient on its own, this works also (removed, correction made below)
not really, what about the case of 1 name?
you would have `and bob`
I’m sure there are some languages out there which don’t need the “ and “, and which have special rules for how you delimit the items
oh well
TextUtils.join it is.. for now
<@U2MJ4NN3C|syed> has joined the channel
<@U0EG5RUBY> sounds like you want a BehaviorSubject <http://reactivex.io/RxJava/javadoc/rx/subjects/BehaviorSubject.html>

we're thinking of enabling the Jack compiler on our project, does anyone have experience with it, or had any trouble recently? it seems to be working from a first try at integration, but just wondering if anyone knows of any potential headaches it might introduce
I'm seeing an APK size increase, strangely. trying to track down why that's happening. 19.6 MB without Jack, 21.8 MB with Jack
perhaps it's coming from switching from the apt plugin to the annotation processor from studio 2.2
<@U0546QERR> you can test that last bit - apply the new annotation processing stuff but disable jack
<@U1JKXJJ11> You should annotate `strings`
possible null pointer there
<@U053LEHJN> ah, right. just tried, and APK is back down to 19.6 MB :confused: the classes.dex files are more bulky with jack
and dex2jar isn't working for me sadly, so that's probably as far as i'm getting
the size increase is live-able, just unfortunate
